text: Fighter Duel is a first-person combat flight simulator developed by Phillips Interactive and Jaeger Software released in Europe in 1995 for the MS-DOS operating system. The game is set during World War II. ==Gameplay== The player must shoot down enemy aircraft in duels in the air. ==Reception== Computer Game Review gave Fighter Duel a mixed review, and called it "best suited for modem and network play." It was a runner-up for Computer Gaming Worlds 1995 "Simulation of the Year" award, which ultimately went to EF2000. The editors praised Fighter Duels "superb modeling of top World War II fighters and its sweat-inducing head-to-head play." ==References== Category:1995 video games Category:Combat flight simulators Category:DOS games Category:DOS-only games Category:Video games developed in the United States
title: Fighter Duel
